channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for DE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for DE

item.title: Report E-2024070655
item.description:
Report E-2024070655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that UN3266 Optisperse HP54434 released from a 330-gallon poly tote due to forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the gravel lot due to a pinhole puncture or faulty valve. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly and 35-gallon poly drums. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
